함정

TRAPS

Types of 함정: A trap can be either mechanical or magic in nature. 기계적 함정 include pits, arrow 함정, 낙하 blocks, water-filled 방, whirling blades, and anything else that depends on a mechanism to operate. A mechanical trap can be constructed by a PC through successful use of the 제작 (trapmaking) skill (see 함정 설계하기, below, and the skill 묘사).

마법 함정 are further divided into spell 함정 and magic device 함정. Magic device 함정 initiate spell effects when activated, just as 마법막대, 마법봉, 반지, and other 마법 아이템 do. Creating a magic device trap requires the 고급 아이템 제작 feat (see 함정 설계하기 and the feat 묘사).

Spell 함정 are simply 주문 that themselves function as 함정. Creating a spell trap requires the services of a character who can cast the needed spell or 주문, who is usually either the character creating the trap or an NPC spellcaster hired for the 목적.

기계적 함정

MECHANICAL TRAPS

던전 are frequently equipped with deadly mechanical (nonmagical) 함정. A trap typically is defined by its location and triggering 상태이상, how hard it is to 감지 before it goes off, how much 피해 it deals, and whether or not the heroes receive a 내성 굴림 to mitigate its effects. 함정 that 공격 with arrows, sweeping blades, and other types of weaponry make normal 명중 굴림, with a specific 공격 보너스 dictated by the trap’s design.

Creatures who succeed on a DC 20 탐색 check detect a simple mechanical trap before it is triggered. (A simple trap is a 올무, a trap triggered by a tripwire, or a large trap such as a pit.)

A character with the 함정 감각 class feature who succeeds on a DC 21 (or higher) 탐색 check detects a well-hidden or complex mechanical trap before it is triggered. Complex 함정 are denoted by their triggering mechanisms and involve pressure plates, mechanisms linked to 문, changes in weight, disturbances in the air, vibrations, and other sorts of unusual 신관.

마법 함정

MAGIC TRAPS

Many 주문 can be used to create dangerous 함정. Unless the spell or item 묘사 states otherwise, assume the following to be true.

• A successful 탐색 check (DC 25 + spell 레벨) made by a 도적 (and only a 도적) detects a magic trap before it goes off. Other characters have no chance to find a magic trap with a 탐색 check.

• 마법 함정 permit a 내성 굴림 in order to avoid the effect (DC 10 + spell 레벨 x 1.5).

• 마법 함정 may be disarmed by a 도적 (and only a 도적) with a successful 장치 무력화 check (DC 25 + spell 레벨).

함정의 요소

ELEMENTS OF A TRAP

All 함정—mechanical or magic—have the following elements: 신관, 초기화, 탐색 DC, 장치 무력화 DC, 공격 보너스 (or 내성 굴림 or onset 지연), 피해/효과, and 도전 지수. Some 함정 may also include optional elements, such as 독 or a 바이패스. These characteristics are described below.

신관

Trigger

A trap’s 신관 determines how it is sprung.

Location: A location 신관 springs a trap when someone stands in a particular square.

Proximity: This 신관 activates the trap when a creature approaches within a certain distance of it. A proximity 신관 differs from a location 신관 in that the creature need not be standing in a particular square. Creatures that are flying can spring a trap with a proximity 신관 but not one with a location 신관. Mechanical proximity 신관 are extremely sensitive to the slightest change in the air. This makes them useful only in places such as crypts, where the air is unusually still.

The proximity 신관 used most often for magic device 함정 is the 알람 spell. Unlike when the spell is cast, an 알람 spell used as a 신관 can have an 범위 that’s no larger than the 범위 the trap is meant to protect.

Some magic device 함정 have special proximity 신관 that activate only when certain kinds of creatures approach. For example, a 선 감지 spell can serve as a proximity 신관 on an evil altar, springing the attached trap only when someone of good 성향 gets close enough to it.

Sound: This 신관 springs a magic trap when it detects any sound. A sound 신관 functions like an ear and has a +15 bonus on 듣기 checks. A successful 조용히 이동 check, magical 침묵, and other effects that would negate hearing defeat it. A trap with a sound 신관 requires the casting of clairaudience during its 제작.

Visual: This 신관 for 마법 함정 works like an actual eye, springing the trap whenever it “sees” something. A trap with a visual 신관 requires the casting of 비전의 눈, clairvoyance, or 진실의 시야 during its 제작. Sight 거리 and the 감지 bonus conferred on the trap depend on the spell chosen, as shown.

SpellSight 거리감지 Bonus

clairvoyanceOne preselected location+15

If you want the trap to “see” in the dark, you must either choose the 진실의 시야 option or add 암흑시야 to the trap as well. (암흑시야 limits the trap’s sight 거리 in the dark to 60 feet.) If 투명화, 변장, or 환영술 can fool the spell being used, they can fool the visual 신관 as well.

Touch: A touch 신관, which springs the trap when touched, is one of the simplest kinds of 신관 to construct. This 신관 may be physically attached to the part of the mechanism that deals the 피해 or it may not. You can make a magic touch 신관 by adding 알람 to the trap and reducing the 범위 of the effect to 엄폐 only the 신관 감지.

Timed: This 신관 periodically springs the trap after a certain 지속시간 has passed.

Spell: All spell 함정 have this kind of 신관. The appropriate spell descriptionsexplain the 신관 상태이상 for 함정 that contain spell 신관.

초기화

Reset

A 초기화 element is the set of 상태이상 under which a trap becomes 준비 to 신관 again.

No 초기화: Short of completely rebuilding the trap, there’s no way to 신관 it more than once. Spell 함정 have no 초기화 element.

Repair: To get the trap functioning again, you must repair it.

Manual: Resetting the trap requires someone to 이동 the parts back into place. This is the kind of 초기화 element most 기계적 함정 have.

Automatic: The trap 초기화 itself, either immediately or after a timed interval.

기계적 함정 수리 또는 초기화하기

Repairing and Resetting Mechanical Traps

Repairing a mechanical trap requires a 제작 (trapmaking) check against a DC equal to the one for building it. The cost for raw materials is one-fifth of the trap’s original 시장 가격. To calculate how long it takes to fix a trap, use the same calculations you would for building it, but use the cost of the raw materials required for repair in place of the 시장 가격.

Resetting a trap usually takes only a minute or so. For a trap with a more difficult 초기화 method, you should set the time and labor required.

바이패스 (선택적 요소)

Bypass (Optional Element)

If the builder of a trap wants to be able to 이동 past the trap after it is created or placed, it’s a good idea to build in a 바이패스 mechanism —something that temporarily 무장해제 the trap. 바이패스 elements are typically used only with 기계적 함정; spell 함정 usually have built-in allowances for the caster to 바이패스 them.

Lock: A lock 바이패스 requires a DC 30 자물쇠 열기 check to open.

Hidden Switch: A hidden switch requires a DC 25 탐색 check to locate.

Hidden Lock: A hidden lock combines the features above, requiring a DC 25 탐색 check to locate and a DC 30 자물쇠 열기 check to open.

탐색 및 장치 무력화에 필요한 Dc

Search and Disable Device DCs

The builder sets the 탐색 및 장치 무력화에 필요한 Dc for a mechanical trap. For a magic trap, the values depend on the highest-레벨 spell used.

Mechanical Trap: The base DC for both 탐색 and 장치 무력화 checks is 20. Raising or lowering either of these DCs affects the base cost (Table: Cost Modifiers for 기계적 함정) and possibly the CR (Table: CR Modifiers for 기계적 함정).

Magic Trap: The DC for both 탐색 and 장치 무력화 checks is equal to 25 + the spell 레벨 of the highest-레벨 spell used. Only characters with the 함정 감각 class feature can attempt a 탐색 check or a 장치 무력화 check involving a magic trap. These DCs do not affect the trap’s cost or CR.

공격 보너스/내성 굴림 Dc

Attack Bonus/Saving Throw DC

A trap usually either makes an 명중 굴림 or forces a 내성 굴림 to avoid it. Occasionally a trap uses both of these options, or neither (see Never Miss).

Pits: These are holes (covered or not) that characters can fall into and take 피해. A pit needs no 명중 굴림, but a successful Reflex save (DC set by the builder) avoids it. Other save-dependent 기계적 함정 also fall into this category.

Pits in 던전 come in three basic varieties: uncovered, covered, and chasms. Pits and chasms can be defeated by judicious application of the 등반 skill, the 도약 skill, or various magical means.

Uncovered pits serve mainly to discourage intruders from going a certain way, although they cause much grief to characters who stumble into them in the dark, and they can greatly complicate a melee taking place nearby.

Covered pits are much more dangerous. They can be detected with a DC 20 탐색 check, but only if the character is taking the time to carefully examine the 범위 before walking across it. A character who fails to detect a covered pit is still entitled to a DC 20 Reflex save to avoid 낙하 into it. However, if she was running or moving recklessly at the time, she gets no 내성 굴림 and falls automatically.

Trap coverings can be as simple as piled refuse (straw, leaves, sticks, garbage), a large rug, or an actual trapdoor concealed to appear as a normal part of the floor. Such a trapdoor usually swings open when enough weight (usually about 50 to 80 pounds) is placed upon it. Devious trap builders sometimes design trapdoors so that they spring back shut after they open. The trapdoor might lock once it’s back in place, leaving the stranded character well and truly trapped. Opening such a trapdoor is just as difficult as opening a regular door (assuming the trapped character can reach it), and a DC 13 근력 check is needed to keep a spring-loaded door open.

Pit 함정 often have something nastier than just a hard floor at the bottom. A trap designer may put spikes, 몬스터, or a pool of acid, lava, or even water at the bottom. Spikes at the bottom of a pit deal 피해 as daggers with a +10 공격 보너스 and a +1 bonus on 피해 for every 10 feet of the fall (to a maximum bonus on 피해 of +5). If the pit has multiple spikes, a 낙하 victim is attacked by 1d4 of them. This 피해 is in addition to any 피해 from the fall itself.

몬스터 sometimes live in pits. Any monster that can fit into the pit might have been placed there by the dungeon’s designer, or might simply have fallen in and not been able to 등반 back out.

A secondary trap, mechanical or magical, at the bottom of a pit can be particularly deadly. Activated by a 낙하 victim, the secondary trap 공격 the already injured character when she’s least 준비 for it.

Ranged 공격 함정: These 함정 fling darts, arrows, spears, or the like at whoever activated the trap. The builder sets the 공격 보너스. A ranged 공격 trap can be configured to simulate the effect of a composite bow with a high 근력 rating which provides the trap with a bonus on 피해 equal to its 근력 rating.

Melee 공격 함정: These 함정 feature such obstacles as sharp blades that emerge from 벽 and stone blocks that fall from ceilings. Once again, the builder sets the 공격 보너스.

피해/효과

Damage/Effect

The effect of a trap is what happens to those who spring it. Usually this takes the form of either 피해 or a spell effect, but some 함정 have special effects.

Pits: 낙하 into a pit deals 1d6 points of 피해 per 10 feet of depth.

Ranged 공격 함정: These 함정 deal whatever 피해 their ammunition normally would. If a trap is constructed with a high 근력 rating, it has a corresponding bonus on 피해.

Melee 공격 함정: These 함정 deal the same 피해 as the melee 무기 they “wield.” In the case of a 낙하 stone block, you can assign any amount of bludgeoning 피해 you like, but remember that whoever 초기화 the trap has to lift that stone back into place.

A melee 공격 trap can be constructed with a built-in bonus on 피해 rolls, just as if the trap itself had a high 근력 score.

Spell 함정: Spell 함정 produce the spell’s effect. Like all 주문, a spell trap that allows a 내성 굴림 has a save DC of 10 + spell 레벨 + caster’s relevant ability modifier.

Magic Device 함정: These 함정 produce the effects of any 주문 included in their 제작, as described in the appropriate entries. If the spell in a magic device trap allows a 내성 굴림, its save DC is 10 + spell 레벨 x 1.5. Some 주문 make 명중 굴림 instead.

Special: Some 함정 have 기타 요소 that produce special effects, such as 숨참기 for a water trap or ability 피해 for 독. 내성 굴림 and 피해 depend on the 독 or are set by the builder, as appropriate.

기타 함정 요소

Miscellaneous Trap Features

Some 함정 include optional features that can make them considerably more deadly. The most common such features are discussed below.

Alchemical Item: 기계적 함정 may incorporate alchemical devices or other special substances or items, such as tanglefoot bags, alchemist’s fire, thunderstones, and the like. Some such items 따라쟁이 spell effects. If the item 따라쟁이 a spell effect, it increases the CR as shown on Table: CR Modifiers for 기계적 함정.

Gas: With a gas trap, the danger is in the inhaled 독 it delivers. 함정 employing gas usually have the never miss and onset 지연 features (see below).

Liquid: Any trap that involves a danger of 숨참기 is in this category. 함정 employing liquid usually have the never miss and onset 지연 features (see below).

Multiple 목표물: 함정 with this feature can affect more than one character.

Never Miss: When the entire dungeon wall 이동 to crush you, your quick reflexes won’t help, since the wall can’t possibly miss. A trap with this feature has neither an 공격 보너스 nor a 내성 굴림 to avoid, but it does have an onset 지연 (see below). Most 함정 involving liquid or gas are of the never miss variety.

Onset 지연: An onset 지연 is the amount of time between when the trap is sprung and when it deals 피해. A never miss trap always has an onset 지연.

독: 함정 that employ 독 are deadlier than their nonpoisonous counterparts, so they have correspondingly higher CRs. To determine the CR modifier for a given 독, consult Table: CR Modifiers for 기계적 함정. Only injury, contact, and inhaled 독 are suitable for 함정; ingested types are not. Some 함정 simply deal the 독’s 피해. Others deal 피해 with ranged or melee 공격 as well.

Pit Spikes: Treat spikes at the bottom of a pit as daggers, each with a +10 공격 보너스. The 피해 bonus for each spike is +1 per 10 feet of pit depth (to a maximum of +5). Each character who falls into the pit is attacked by 1d4 spikes. Pit spikes do not add to the average 피해 of the trap (see Average 피해, below).

Pit Bottom: If something other than spikes waits at the bottom of a pit, it’s best to treat that as a separate trap (see Multiple 함정, below) with a location 신관 that activates on any significant impact, such as a 낙하 character.

Touch 공격: This feature applies to any trap that needs only a successful touch 공격 (melee or ranged) to hit.

함정 설계하기

DESIGNING A TRAP

기계적 함정: Simply select the elements you want the trap to have and add up the adjustments to the trap’s 도전 지수 that those elements require (see Table: CR Modifiers for 기계적 함정) to arrive at the trap’s final CR. From the CR you can derive the DC of the 제작 (trapmaking) checks a character must make to construct the trap.

마법 함정: As with 기계적 함정, you don’t have to do anything other than decide what elements you want and then determine the CR of the resulting trap (see Table: CR Modifiers for 마법 함정). If a player character wants to design and construct a magic trap, he must have the 고급 아이템 제작 feat. In addition, he must be able to cast the spell or 주문 that the trap requires—or, failing that, he must be able to hire an NPC to cast the 주문 for him.

함정의 도전 지수

Challenge Rating of a Trap

To calculate the 함정의 도전 지수, add all the CR modifiers (see the tables below) to the base CR for the trap type.

Mechanical Trap: The base CR for a mechanical trap is 0. If your final CR is 0 or lower, add features until you get a CR of 1 or higher.

Magic Trap: For a spell trap or magic device trap, the base CR is 1. The highest-레벨 spell used modifies the CR (see Table: CR Modifiers for 마법 함정).

Average 피해: If a trap (either mechanical or magic) does hit point 피해, calculate the average 피해 for a successful hit and round that value to the nearest multiple of 7. Use this value to adjust the 도전 지수 of the trap, as indicated on the tables below. 피해 from 독 and pit spikes does not count toward this value, but 피해 from a high 근력 rating and extra 피해 from multiple 공격 does.

For a magic trap, only one modifier applies to the CR—either the 레벨 of the highest-레벨 spell used in the trap, or the average 피해 figure, whichever is larger.

Multiple 함정: If a trap is really two or more connected 함정 that affect approximately the same 범위, determine the CR of each one separately.

Multiple Dependent 함정: If one trap depends on the success of the other (that is, you can avoid the second trap altogether by not 낙하 victim to the first), they must be treated as separate 함정.

Multiple Independent 함정: If two or more 함정 act independently (that is, none depends on the success of another to activate), use their CRs to determine their combined Encounter 레벨 as though they were 몬스터. The resulting Encounter 레벨 is the CR for the combined 함정.

기계적 함정 비용

Mechanical Trap Cost

The base cost of a mechanical trap is 1,000 gp. Apply all the modifiers from Table: Cost Modifiers for 기계적 함정 for the various features you’ve added to the trap to get the modified base cost.

The final cost is equal to (modified base cost x 도전 지수) + extra costs. The minimum cost for a mechanical trap is (CR x 100) gp.

After you’ve multiplied the modified base cost by the 도전 지수, add the price of any alchemical items or 독 you incorporated into the trap. If the trap uses one of these elements and has an automatic 초기화, multiply the 독 or alchemical item cost by 20 to provide an adequate supply of doses.

Multiple 함정: If a trap is really two or more connected 함정, determine the final cost of each separately, then add those values together. This holds for both multiple dependent and multiple independent 함정 (see the previous section).
